ygData.subject: Re: Charging for services.
ygData.msgSnippet: I always tell people that I work on Doanations or offerings. I have never said I will cjharge 1 pp etcc because I had seen a friend say that and once he got
ygData.messageBody:
I always tell people that I work on Doanations or offerings. I have never
said I will cjharge 1 pp etcc because I had seen a friend say that and once
he got the fare to his corpse he just left and did not even pay for it. If
you make the other person feel that you are helping from the kindness of
your heart they feel compeled to help you in turn. I once got a Mino Axe and
a Snakeskin tunic for free like this. Not the 29pp like the other guy but
still over 10 pp worth if goods.

:)

Koden

----- Original Message -----
From: Reedo <reedo@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Saturday, May 08, 1999 1:26 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Charging for services.


> From: "Reedo" <reedo@...>
>
> I have never set a price for my services because I find that donations
work
> out very well. When I hit level 4 and got the spell someone needed help
> right away. I helped him and got 3PP. That was a fortune at level 3. A
> few levels later while fighting in West Karana I heard someone cry out for
> help. I had to run to the zone with Croon and Froon chasing me but he got
> his corpse. After we met back up I got about 29 PP worth of stuff from
him.
> That is BY FAR the best I have been paid. If people ask I usually tell
them
> I have received between 1GP and 29PP before. I usually get about 1PP
> depending on the difficulty. I think I'll stick with this practice. But
if
> I am running to somewhere an catch up to someone going the same place I
will
> invite them and speed them up for no charge. But if I have to go out of
my
> way I probably would.
>
> Arden
> Cazic-Thule
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Give back to your community through "Grow to Give."
> http://www.onelist.com
> See homepage for details.
>
